answers.answer: Complications of polycystic ovary syndrome include:Increased risk of endometriall cancerIncreased risk of obesity related conditions (such as high blood pressure anddiabetes)Possible increased risk for breast cancerIn women with polycystic ovary disease who also have insulin resistance, glucophage (Metformin), a medication that makes cells more sensitive to insulin, has been shown to make ovulation normalFor women with this condition who are overweight, weight loss can reduce insulin resistance, stimulate ovulation, and improve fertility rates.Since being overweight or obese is a risk factor for breast cancer,  it is possible that  weight loss in women with polycystic ovary disease who are overweight might also lower the POSSIBLE increased risk for breast cancer associated with that disease.Best wishes...
